intro: Potentilla asiae-mediae, commonly known as the Asian potentilla, is a perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features dense, upright stems covered in fine, silvery hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a slightly hairy texture. Potentilla asiae-mediae is well adapted to rocky and arid environments, thriving in full sun and well-drained soil.
